channel.title: [PI] Money Pouch PM
channel.description: I just noticed that whenever you take money out of your money pouch, it will send whatever number you typed to the most recent person you pmed. Is there a way to fix this? EXAMPLE - A. "Hey whats up" to B B. "nothing" to A *20 mins later* B types 10m to take out of money pouch B. "10m" to A

item.title: [PI] Money Pouch PM

item.title: [PI] Money Pouch PM
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

Sup22211:

Post here your money pouch code, the message in your code most be wrong…

Here is the withdraw code, I put it under the rightClickMiniMap method in client.java (client sided)

if(interfaceButtonAction == 557 && promptInput.length() > 0) { if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("k")) { promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("k", "000"); } else if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("m")) { promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("m", "000000"); } else if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("b")) { promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("b", "000000000"); } inputString = "::withdraw "+promptInput; sendPacket(103); }
Do you need my PM codes also?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Money Pouch PM
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

		if (l == 713) {
                        //withdraw action
                                            inputTaken = true;
                                            messagePromptRaised = true;
                                            amountOrNameInput = "";
                                            inputDialogState = 0;
                                            interfaceButtonAction = 557;
                                            aString1121 = "Enter amount";
                                        if(interfaceButtonAction == 557 && promptInput.length() > 0) {
						if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("k")) {
							promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("k", "000");
						} else if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("m")) {
							promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("m", "000000");
						} else if (promptInput.toLowerCase().contains("b")) {
							promptInput = promptInput.replaceAll("b", "000000000");
						}
						inputString = "::withdraw "+promptInput;
						sendPacket(103);
					}

Pulled this out of some random source, might help.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Money Pouch PM
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

I just noticed that whenever you take money out of your money pouch, it will send whatever number you typed to the most recent person you pmed.
Is there a way to fix this?
EXAMPLE -
A. “Hey whats up” to B
B. “nothing” to A
20 mins later
B types 10m to take out of money pouch
B. “10m” to A

Read full topic
